newsitem.title: USA: Market valuation key question for investors -- Rubin.
newsitem.headline: Market valuation key question for investors -- Rubin.

text.p: Wall Street investors need to gauge whether the stock market is fairly valued as well as the outlook for the U.S. economy in deciding where to put their money, Treasury Secretary Robert Rubin said Wednesday.

"Not only do they need to look at what they think economic prospects are going to be ... they also have to keep in mind how they think the market is valuing those prospects," Rubin told public television's Nightly Business Report.
"Is the market undervaluing them, is it overvaluing them or is it about right?" he asked.
